notesStmt.note: Damp entry at edges and ends, tidemarks and mould darkening. Losses at ends have been infilled.

Date 74 [1314] in an inscription written by the scribe (folio 167v). Includes a chart of the nineteen-year cycles starting from 1307 (folio 182r). Teḳufot (equinoxes and solstices) in the calendar for the period 1308-1335 (folios 182v-183r). A later addition to the calendar for the period 1352-1370 (folio 178v). Illegible Hebrew inscriptions (folio 197v). Inscription with the title (folio 1r).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p:
16 quires: i5 (folios 2-6), ii8 (folios 7-14), iii-ix8 (folios 15-70), x4 (folios 71-74), xi-xxiii8 (folios 75-178), xxiv6 (folios 179-184), xxv5 (folios 185-189), xxvi8 (folios 190-197).
Catchwords at the end of each quire, some of them are decorated.

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript: inscribed (f. [198v]); his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co. (b. 1800, d. 1853), Berlin bookseller and dealer to the British Museum.
